name: English Colonies in the Americas Quiz | History | 15 Questions

questions.text: What was the first colony established by the English in North America?
questions.explanation:
Virginia.

	Jamestown, Virginia, the first permanent English settlement in N. America, was founded in 1607.

Georgia.

	It was founded in 1732 by James Oglethorpe as a haven for debtors.

questions.text: Which colony was set up as a 'mediaeval experiment'?
questions.explanation:
Carolina.

	A group of eight English nobles wanted to set up a colony based on life in the middle ages.

questions.text: In what year did the Pilgrims arrive at Plymouth Rock?
Who DID NOT leave or was kicked out of Massachusetts because he did not agree with Puritan beliefs?
questions.explanation:
James Oglethorpe.

	Hooker founded Connecticut, Wheelwright founded New Hampshire, and Williams founded Rhode Island.

questions.text: Which of the following colonies is INCORRECTLY matched with its founder?
questions.explanation:
North Carolina -- Oglethorpe.

	Oglethorpe, as I previously mentioned, founded Georgia as a home for debtors and poor people.

questions.text: Cecil Calvert was also known as Lord ____________?
questions.explanation:
Baltimore.

	He founded Maryland as a haven for Catholics to get away from Puritan persecution.

questions.text: In 1588, what battle took place, the result of which allowed England to colonize America, because Spain no longer controlled the Atlantic Ocean?
options: Battle of the Piece of Cheese

questions.text: Who was NOT involved with the founding of Jamestown?
Who was the first governor of Massachusetts?
The first written plan of government in America was in Connecticut. What was it called?
options: The Written Plan of Government for Connecticut

questions.text: The Duke of York took over New York from the ________?
questions.explanation:
Dutch.

	New York and New Jersey were formerly New Netherland.

questions.text: 'A nation becomes more powerful by expanding its trade.' What is this theory called?
Which of the following was NOT one of the thirteen colonies?

questions.explanation:
Amerigo Vespucci.

	Amerigo Vespucci was the first person to figure out that America had to be a new continent and not part of Asia.
